Plot Isotype Counts For Ig Data

Source: R/plot_vdj.R
PlotIsotypeCounts.Rd

PlotIsotypeCounts Merges isotypes together using data from AnalyzeGenes and plots the data either as a donut plot or bar plot.

PlotIsotypeCounts(
  gene_data,
  plot.type = "bar",
  palette = "bold",
  barOutline = FALSE,
  interactive = FALSE,
  gridlines = TRUE,
  alpha = 0.5,
  label = TRUE,
  theme = "pubr",
  bg.color = "light"
)

Arguments

gene_data

Data from running AnalyzeGenes
plot.type

Plot as either a barplot or donut plot
palette

Any ggsci, color brewer, or palettes available from PullPalettes
barOutline

Logical. Whether to include a black outline around the bars in the plot
interactive

Logical. Plot interactive plotly plots or flat plots
gridlines

Logical. Include y-axis
alpha

Numerical between 0-1. Alpha level applied to bar-fill.
label

Logical. Add numerical label to the top of the bars
theme

Either ggpubr::theme_pubr("pubr"), or ggpubr::pubclean ("clean"), or ggpubr::theme_transparent ("transparent")
bg.color

Helpful param for applying a global light or dark theme in a scheme, such as global theme for Shiny apps. "light" or "dark".

Value

PlotIsotypeCounts returns plot of isotype counts for Ig data

Details

Both plot options offered as flat or interactive plots using the interactive param. Available palettes are pulled from PullPalettes

See also

AnalyzeGenes

Examples

plot <- PlotIsotypeCount(genes, plot.type = "donut", palette="new_england", interactive=TRUE)
#> Error in PlotIsotypeCount(genes, plot.type = "donut", palette = "new_england",     interactive = TRUE): could not find function "PlotIsotypeCount"
